summary: Critical prototype pollution vulnerability (CVE-2023-36665) in protobufjs 7.2.3, a transitive dependency of @temporalio/client. The vulnerability allows attackers to pollute Object.prototype through malicious protobuf messages, with a CVSS score of 9.8.
userImpact: Users of @temporalio/client are exposed to critical prototype pollution attacks through the vulnerable protobufjs transitive dependency.
rootCause: protobufjs versions 6.10.0 through 7.x before 7.2.4 contain a prototype pollution vulnerability allowing Object.prototype to be modified through user-controlled protobuf messages.
proposedFix: Upgrade protobufjs to version 7.2.4 or later
resolutionDetails: Issue was closed, likely by upgrading protobufjs to a patched version (7.2.4+)
keyQuote: protobuf.js (aka protobufjs) 6.10.0 through 7.x before 7.2.4 allows Prototype Pollution... A user-controlled protobuf message can be used by an attacker to pollute the prototype of Object.prototype
